home.title: Bhuvaneshwari Devi Temple
home.subtitle: Divine Abode of Goddess Bhuvaneshwari
home.description: Experience the divine grace of Goddess Bhuvaneshwari, the Mistress of the World, in the serene Garhwal hills of Uttarakhand
home.welcomeText: The Bhuvaneshwari Devi Temple in the Neelkanth area of Uttarakhand, India, is a sacred site for devotees, offering spectacular views of the Garhwal hills. Located near Pauri, it serves as both a spiritual sanctuary and a traditional school based on the Guru-Shishya methodology.

about.title: About Bhuvaneshwari Devi Temple
about.subtitle: A Sacred Journey Through Divine Heritage
about.locationDesc: The Bhuvaneshwari Devi Temple is situated on a hilltop in the Pauri District of Uttarakhand, approximately 15 km from the town of Pauri.
about.goddessDesc: Goddess Bhuvaneshwari is considered the 'Mistress of the World' and a form of the divine feminine energy. She represents the cosmic power that creates, maintains, and transforms the universe.
about.scenicViewsDesc: From the temple, visitors can enjoy breathtaking views of the surrounding Garhwal Himalayas.
about.guruShishyaDesc: A traditional school, operating under the Guru-Shishya (teacher-disciple) tradition, is also located at the temple site.
about.neelkanthDesc: The temple is in the vicinity of the famous Neelkanth Mahadev Temple. The name Neelkanth (meaning 'blue-throated') comes from the legend of Lord Shiva consuming poison during the Samudra Manthan (churning of the ocean), which turned his throat blue.
